thread.title: Iowa weather: December 2023 in Des Moines was warmest in over 130 years
thread.title_full: Iowa weather: December 2023 in Des Moines was warmest in over 130 years

author: Zane Satre
title: Iowa weather: December 2023 in Des Moines was warmest in over 130 years
text: Des Moines records its warmest December in over 130 years Last month was also one of the least snowy on record. Last month was also one of the least snowy on record. Last month was also one of the least snowy on record. By winter standards, December 2023 was a scorcher in central Iowa. Last month will go down in history as the second warmest December since records began in the 1870s. Des Moines' average temperature for the month was 37.4 degrees, nearly 10 degrees above normal. For perspective, that's closer to the typical average temperature in November or March. [Get the latest Iowa weather forecast from KCCI](https://www.kcci.com/weather) Least snowy December in over 20 years December 2023 was also nearly snow-free around Des Moines. While other parts of the state received measurable snow, particularly southern Iowa, the capital city picked up just 0.2 inches last month. The last time Des Moines recorded so little snowfall in December was 2002, when only a trace fell. Overall precipitation was close to normal for the month, but that was almost entirely due to the significant rainfall from Christmas Eve into Christmas Day. Without that holiday rain, Des Moines was on track for a top 15 driest December. A very warm, dry year overall Last year as a whole was much warmer & drier than average. Des Moines tallied its sixth warmest year in history in 2023. This past year joins 2012, 2015, 2016, and 2017 amongst the top 10 warmest since records started. Annual precipitation only added up to about 25 inches. That's only around two-thirds of normal and low enough for 19th driest in the record books.
